section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Commercial loan" means a loan that is made:
Solely to acquire or carry on a business or commercial enterprise; or
To any business or commercial organization.
"Consumer loan" means a loan that is made primarily for personal, family, or household purposes.
"Executive officer" has the meaning stated in Title 12 of the Code of Federal Regulations, § 215.2.

text.section:
Unless the loan is approved or exempted from approval as provided in this section, the following persons may not borrow, directly or indirectly, any money from a banking institution:
Any director, officer, or employee of the banking institution;
Any partnership of which the director, officer, or employee is a member; or
Any corporation in which the director, officer, or employee is an officer or owns the majority interest.

This section does not require approval of:
A commercial loan that is made to:
A director of the banking institution, unless the director also is an officer or employee of the banking institution;
A partnership of which the director is a member, unless an officer or employee of the banking institution also is a member of that partnership; or
A corporation in which the director holds any interest, unless an officer or employee of the banking institution is an officer or owns the majority interest in that corporation; or
A loan that is:
A consumer loan; and
Is made to an employee of a banking institution who is not an executive officer or director of the banking institution.

section.section:
A loan to a director, officer, or employee of a banking institution may be made only if the loan has been approved by a resolution adopted at and recorded in the minutes of a meeting of:
The board of directors of the banking institution; or
The executive committee of the banking institution, if that committee is authorized to make loans.
If a loan is approved by an executive committee, the loan approval shall be reported to the board of directors at its next meeting.
A loan made under this section shall be reviewed every 6 months by the board of directors.
The loan may not be renewed or extended unless the renewal or extension has been approved by a resolution adopted at a meeting of the board of directors and recorded in the minutes of the meeting.

text.section: All loans to a director, officer, or employee of a banking institution are subject to the limitations imposed by § 3-601 of this article.
